bug.author: nemanja-rakicevic
bug.summary: wandb init on VM causes syntax error
bug.description:
Hi, I tried running wandb on a Azure VM. I use the same conda environment as on the local machine, with same version of wandb==0.10.4 and python==3.5.6. However, when I try to run wandb login on the VM to continue the sweep, I get: <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/bin/wandb", line 11, in <module> sys.exit(cli()) File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/click/core.py", line 829, in __call__ return self.main(*args, **kwargs) File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/click/core.py", line 782, in main rv = self.invoke(ctx) File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1259, in invoke return _process_result(sub_ctx.command.invoke(sub_ctx)) File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1066, in invoke return ctx.invoke(self.callback, **ctx.params) File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/click/core.py", line 610, in invoke return callback(*args, **kwargs) File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/wandb/cli/cli.py", line 74, in wrapper return func(*args, **kwargs) File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/wandb/cli/cli.py", line 223, in login base_url=host, File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/wandb/sdk_py27/wandb_setup.py", line 235, in setup ret = _setup(settings=settings) File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/wandb/sdk_py27/wandb_setup.py", line 230, in _setup wl = _WandbSetup(settings=settings) File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/wandb/sdk_py27/wandb_setup.py", line 219, in __init__ _WandbSetup._instance = _WandbSetup__WandbSetup(settings=settings) File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/wandb/sdk_py27/wandb_setup.py", line 92, in __init__ self._load_viewer(settings=settings) File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/wandb/sdk_py27/wandb_setup.py", line 159, in _load_viewer s = server.Server(settings=settings) File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/wandb/lib/server.py", line 17, in __init__ self._api = api or InternalApi(default_settings=settings) File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/wandb/apis/internal.py", line 9, in __init__ self.api = InternalApi(*args, **kwargs) File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/wandb/internal/internal_api.py", line 78, in __init__ self.default_settings.update(default_settings or {}) File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/wandb/sdk_py27/wandb_settings.py", line 781, in __getitem__ return getattr(self, k) File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/wandb/sdk_py27/wandb_settings.py", line 387, in _console if self._jupyter: File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/wandb/sdk_py27/wandb_settings.py", line 368, in _jupyter return _get_python_type() != "python" File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/wandb/lib/ipython.py", line 16, in _get_python_type from IPython import get_ipython File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/IPython/__init__.py", line 55, in <module> from .terminal.embed import embed File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/IPython/terminal/embed.py", line 16, in <module> from IPython.terminal.interactiveshell import TerminalInteractiveShell File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/IPython/terminal/interactiveshell.py", line 32, in <module> from .debugger import TerminalPdb, Pdb File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/IPython/terminal/debugger.py", line 6, in <module> from IPython.core.completer import IPCompleter File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/IPython/core/completer.py", line 146, in <module> import jedi File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/jedi/__init__.py", line 41, in <module> from jedi.api import Script, Interpreter, set_debug_function, \ File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/jedi/api/__init__.py", line 15, in <module> import parso File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/parso/__init__.py", line 41, in <module> from parso.parser import ParserSyntaxError File "/home/petar/anaconda3/envs/infosearch_env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/parso/parser.py", line 113 node_map: Dict[str, type] = {} ^ SyntaxError: invalid syntax
</denchmark-code>
Any ideas what is causing this?

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.96. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/wandb/client>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
This is due to the version of python not supporting our type definitions. Are you able to run in a python environment version 3.6 or higher?

The type annotation issue appears to be with the "parso" package, I think you can avoid this failure by doing: `pip install -U parso==0.7.1` 0.7.1 is the last release that supports python2 <denchmark-link:#>‚Ä¶</denchmark-link>
On Thu, Oct 8, 2020 at 8:33 AM Chris Van Pelt ***@***.***> wrote: This is due to the version of python not supporting our type definitions. Are you able to run in a python environment version 3.6 or higher?
‚Äî You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#1338 (comment)>, or unsubscribe <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAN7MP7IOQIAERNFIIH5FTDSJXLWFANCNFSM4SIVFFAQ> .
Amazing, thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/raubitsj>@raubitsj</denchmark-link> solved my issue! But I'm not sure why python2 was invoked, since my environment uses python3.
